name: Jonathan Shapiro
content: Jonathan Shapiro - Research Explorer The University of Manchester Jonathan Shapiro Dr Reader, Machine Learning and Robotics https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9572-9544 Personal profile BiographyI am a Reader in the School of Computer Science, where I teach and carry out research on machine learning, probabilistic modeling and evolutionary algorithms. I have particular interests in reinforcement learning and active learning for optimization. I am the head of the Machine Learning and Optimization Research Group in the School of Computer Science, Deputy Director of CICADA, an interdisciplinary project on hybrid systems spaning the schools of Computer Science, Control Engineering and Mathematics. I have previously been associated with the Santa Fe Institute, through their programs on Adaptive Computation and Evolutionary Dynamics and by directing their Complex Systems Summer School in 2003. Previously, I was a research theoretical physicist at the University of Manchester and the University of California, where I did research on condensed matter physics.My groupData Science InstituteMachine Learning and OptimisationOpportunitiesI currrently have projects in machine learning applied to optimization, learning in multi-agent systems and methods of adaptation in hybrid dynamical systems associated with the CICADA project. Students with a good background in probabilistic mathematics or physics are particularly welcome. Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
